name: places/ChIJ91oq1YD2wokRPgNd-EnlSMM
formattedAddress: 885 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 885 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10032-5134, USA

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed rooms & a suite in a cozy bed-and-breakfast set in a 19th-century redbrick townhouse.

originalText.text:
Cozy and quaint. To answer questions that I had as a guest:
Yes, they take the whole payment up front.
They will send you check in information the day of your reservation. This freaked me out a little bit because I sent 2 emails in the week leading up and they went unanswered.
There is a kitchen, toilet, and separate shower. All were clean enough. No breakfast was provided. The rooms were clean but the beds were incredibly uncomfortable.
We had a lovely stay, and all things considered i would stay here again knowing what I know now. Lawrence the innkeeper was very kind.

I wouldn’t call this a B&B experience, it’s a hostel if anything. But it was a safe and clean place to unwind after long days in the city.

originalText.text: This place is a hidden gem! You absolutely cannot beat the price. The owner bent over backwards to get us into our room early and was extremely kind to us. The C train connection is literally two houses down so it’s very convenient to get downtown or almost anywhere. It was clean, quiet, and we felt very safe.

text.text: This place is a hidden gem! You absolutely cannot beat the price. The owner bent over backwards to get us into our room early and was extremely kind to us. The C train connection is literally two houses down so it’s very convenient to get downtown or almost anywhere. It was clean, quiet, and we felt very safe.

originalText.text:
My stay in this guest house was very nice and comfy! The house is old, but with all the comfort you need! The host is great very helpful and kind.
We stayed just for the nights, because during the day we were always out exploring the city.
The location of the house is in upper Manhattan, half an hour far, with subway, from Time square and the main city center
The Subway stop is 50 m from the door, so it's very close !
I recommend this place to someone who is searching for something nice, not to fancy, not to centrally located, not too expensive, but still good and comfortable!

originalText.text: Only if you don’t have anywhere else to stay. I had to rely on another guest to get in, no one really checked me in, no breakfast nothing. There were no signs on the doors so I had to physically try every door before I found my room. To much for 155$ a night

originalText.text: This hotel is a great deal considering how expensive NYC hotels have become. It’s affordable and in a great location. I would 100% stay here again.
